summary_diagnostic: About 30 questions from all grammar topics (random order). Wrong answers point to topics you need to revise.
summary_practice: Cloze-style mixed practice from all topics.

questions.question: I have _____ to London many times.
questions.explanation: Present perfect for life experience: have/has + past participle.

questions.question: She _____ (work) here since 2020.
questions.explanation: Since + period up to now → present perfect.

questions.question: I _____ him yesterday.
questions.explanation: Yesterday = finished time → past simple.

questions.question: Have you _____ been to Japan?
questions.explanation: Life experience (no specific time) → present perfect; 'ever' is common.

questions.question: The meeting is _____ Monday.
questions.explanation: Days of the week → on (on Monday, on Friday).

questions.question: She lives _____ London.
questions.explanation: Cities and countries → in (in London, in England).

questions.question: The woman _____ lives next door is a doctor.
questions.explanation: Person as subject of the clause → who or that.

questions.question: This is the house _____ I was born.
questions.explanation: Place → where (in which).

questions.question: I think it _____ rain tomorrow.
questions.explanation: Prediction or belief → will. Plan/intention → going to.

questions.question: We _____ to the cinema tonight. We've got tickets.
questions.explanation: Planned intention (tickets) → going to.

questions.question: I want _____ learn English.
questions.explanation: Want + to-infinitive (not -ing).

questions.question: She enjoys _____ in the evening.
questions.explanation: Enjoy + -ing form (not to-infinitive).

questions.question: We need _____ for two nights.
questions.explanation: Accommodation: double c and double m.

questions.question: I will _____ be there.
questions.explanation: Definitely: -ite- (from finite).

questions.question: This box is _____ than the other one.
questions.explanation: Comparative: short adjective + -er (heavy → heavier), or more + long adjective.

questions.question: She is the _____ student in the class.
questions.explanation: Superlative: the + -est or the most + adjective (best, tallest, etc.).

questions.question: They _____ here for five years.
questions.explanation: For + period up to now → present perfect.

questions.question: When _____ you _____ to Paris?
questions.explanation: When (specific past time) → past simple.

questions.question: I'll see you _____ 9 o'clock.
questions.explanation: Clock times → at (at 9 o'clock, at noon).

questions.question: The book _____ I'm reading is very good.
questions.explanation: Thing as object → which or that.

questions.question: Look at the clouds. It _____ rain.
questions.explanation: Evidence in the present (clouds) → going to.

questions.question: I look forward to _____ you.
questions.explanation: Look forward to + -ing (to is a preposition here).

questions.question: Which is correct?
questions.explanation: Accommodation: double c, double m.

questions.question: She's _____ than her sister.
questions.explanation: Short adjective (tall) → -er: taller.

questions.question: The letter _____ (send) yesterday.
questions.explanation: Past passive: was + past participle (sent).

questions.question: English _____ (speak) in many countries.
questions.explanation: Present simple passive: is + spoken.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
questions.explanation: Passive = was + past participle. Send → sent.

questions.question: I have _____ apple.
questions.explanation: An before vowel sound (apple).

questions.question: _____ sun is shining.
questions.explanation: The for specific (the sun).

questions.question: She is _____ doctor. I'll see you in _____ hour.
questions.explanation: A before consonant sound; an before vowel sound (hour).

questions.question: When I arrived, she _____ (cook) dinner.
questions.explanation: Past continuous for action in progress when another event happened.

questions.question: I _____ (watch) TV when the phone rang.
questions.explanation: Past continuous: was/were + -ing for background action.

questions.question: When the phone rang, I _____ .
questions.explanation: Action in progress when something happened → past continuous.

questions.question: We need to _____ the meeting. (postpone)
questions.explanation: Put off = postpone.

questions.question: Don't _____ ! (stop trying)
questions.explanation: Give up = stop trying.

questions.question: 'Look after' means:
questions.explanation: Look after = take care of.

questions.question: I don't know what _____ . (the answer is)
questions.explanation: Embedded question: statement word order (what the answer is).

questions.question: Can you tell me where _____ ? (the station is)
questions.explanation: Embedded question: where the station is (statement order).

questions.question: Which is correct?

options.a: I don't know what the answer is.
options.b: I don't know what is the answer.
options.c: I don't know what the answer.
options.d: I don't know what does the answer.

questions.explanation: Embedded question: use statement word order (subject + verb).

questions.question: "I am tired." → She said she _____ tired.
questions.explanation: Reported speech: present → past (am → was).

questions.question: "Where do you live?" → He asked me where I _____ .
questions.explanation: Reported question: statement order; backshift to past.

questions.question: "Close the door." → He _____ me to close the door.
questions.explanation: Reported command: tell + person + to-infinitive.

questions.question: Zero: If you heat ice, it _____ .
questions.explanation: Zero conditional: present + present for facts.

questions.question: First: If it _____ tomorrow, we will stay at home.
questions.explanation: First conditional: if + present (rains), will in main clause.

questions.question: Second: If I _____ (have) more time, I would help you.
questions.explanation: Second conditional: if + past simple.

questions.question: Third conditional: If I had known, I _____ you.
questions.explanation: Third conditional: would have + past participle in main clause.
